meanings.definition: Not new or original; familiar or common.
meanings.sent1: The movie was quite nonnovel, following the same predictable plot as many others.
meanings.sent2: The song had a nonnovel melody that reminded everyone of a popular tune from last year.
meanings.sent3: The nonnovel joke made everyone chuckle, even though they had heard it before.
meanings.sent4: Her nonnovel excuse for being late was like a broken record, always the same.
meanings.sent5: The nonnovel smell of fresh cookies wafted through the house, bringing back memories.

meanings.definition: A work of fiction that is not new or original; a derivative or unoriginal story.
meanings.sent1: The bookshelves were filled with nonnovels that all seemed to blend together.
meanings.sent2: She decided to write a nonnovel for her first attempt at a novel, using familiar tropes.
meanings.sent3: The nonnovel on the bestseller list was a disappointment to critics who expected more.
meanings.sent4: His life felt like a nonnovel, with each day repeating the previous one in a loop.
meanings.sent5: The nonnovel was like a patchwork quilt of recycled ideas, lacking originality.
